data.text:
@MarkPlackett1 @venessb @sallycapp @CloverMoore The University of Melbourne is running a pilot with the City of Melbourne, the unions, and property owners to look at different ventilation strategies, as presented by Dominique Hes at last week’s Building Ventilation Summit. 
https://t.co/K1KV7EQafi

@MarkPlackett1 @venessb @sallycapp @CloverMoore The Victorian government has set up a suite of #covidsafe resources about ventilation, aimed at specific types of spaces (café, gym, retail, etc.) at https://t.co/aSCX9CP1R5 and is launching a Ventilation Voucher scheme as part of its stimulus package – https://t.co/Qd6xjf5LHI.
@DavidAn47333835 @takesthecake2 Yes, @takesthecake2, what David said! We just started with some of our networks, thus the medical and scientific community skew.
@takesthecake2 @venessb For all concerned Australian citizens and residents!
@takesthecake2 @venessb Everyone can sign 😊👍 have a look in the letter, you can see the people who have signed are very diverse
@venessb Hi Ben, Can u let me know if this is just for medical folk to sign, or all concerned Aus citizens?
@venessb Your 5 mins of fame is almost done Benny. https://t.co/B3amriJTzb
@venessb Poor last attempt at staying relevant.

@venessb How about releasing the advice, metrics and exact criteria to support restrictions before they're even implemented.

Seeing as how not a single country has used NPI to any benefits during Omicron. I think it's incumbent on governments to explain why they're using them still.
